page.title: 16FLAT TOPPED HOUSE
page.content: The area is very flat. It consists of cultivated fields of barley, wheat and sugar beet, with some pasture land for grazing cattle. A second-class road, the B1363 runs north-south to the west of the centre of the area. The road has wide grass verges and is bordered by hawthorn hedges. All the fields in the area have well-established hedga borders. In a few places are growing oak, ash and silver birch trees. A small stream runs east-west across the south part of the area The stream is contained in a wide ditch. There are two farms in the area .
